poem:
### The Voice of Velvet

In the curl of a note,  
Jack weaved golden threads,  
a tapestry of song,  
where heartbeats skipped,  
lilting across decades.  
Sinatra's nod--a knighted chord,  
three lengths ahead,  
breathless in the hush  
of easy melodies,  
his voice—a warm embrace  
cupped in the palm of twilight.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jack Jones obituary In a six-decade career, Jack Jones, who has died of leukaemia aged 86, enjoyed a six-decade career that became one of the most popular and admired singers of mainstream easy-listening music. His supple, expressive voice enabled him to wring the maximum expression from a lyric, and Frank Sinatra once tipped him as “the best singer in the business. He has a distinction, an all-round quality that puts him potentially about three lengths". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
